1.text: And the whole earth was of one language, and of one speech.

2.text: And it came to pass as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar, and they dwelt there.

3.text: And they said one to another, come, let us make brick, and burn them thoroughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for mortar.

4.text: And they said, come, let us build us a city, and a tower, whose top may reach to heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we should be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.

5.text: And the LORD came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men were building.

6.text: And the LORD said, Behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.

7.text: Come, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.

8.text: So the LORD scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off to build the city.

9.text: Therefore is the name of it called Babel, because the LORD there confounded the language of all the earth: and from thence did the LORD scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.

10.text: These are the generations of Shem: Shem was a hundred years old, and begat Arphaxad two years after the flood:

11.text: And Shem lived after he begat Arphaxad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.

12.text: And Arphaxad lived five and thirty years, and begat Salah.

13.text: And Arphaxad lived after he begat Salah four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.

14.text: And Salah lived thirty years, and begat Eber:

15.text: And Salah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.

16.text: And Eber lived four and thirty years, and begat Peleg:

17.text: And Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.

18.text: And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:

19.text: And Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.

20.text: And Reu lived two and thirty years, and begat Serug.

21.text: And Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.

22.text: And Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor:

23.text: And Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.

24.text: And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah.

25.text: And Nahor lived after he begat Terah a hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.

26.text: And Terah lived seventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

27.text: Now these are the generations of Terah: Terah begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran: and Haran begat Lot.

28.text: And Haran died before his father Terah, in the land of his nativity, in Ur of the Chaldees.

29.text: And Abram and Nahor took them wives: the name of Abram’s wife was Sarai; and the name of Nahor’s wife Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah.

30.text: But Sarai was barren; she had no child.

31.text: And Terah took Abram his son, and Lot the son of Haran his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram’s wife; and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan; and they came to Haran, and dwelt there.

32.text: And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years: and Terah died in Haran.
